trans-unit.source: Represents a geographical location that is determined by latitude and longitude coordinates.
May also include altitude, accuracy, speed, and course information.
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> that has no data fields set.
All data fields are set to <xref:System.Double.NaN>.
The new instance of <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate> is equivalent to <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Unknown>.
This constructor should be used for serialization.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> class from latitude and longitude data.
The latitude and longitude values must correspond to an actual location on the globe.
The latitude of the location.
May range from -90.0 to 90.0.
The longitude of the location.
May range from -180.0 to 180.0.
Latitude or longitude is out of range.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> class from latitude, longitude, and altitude data.
The latitude and longitude values must correspond to an actual location on the globe.
Latitude.
May range from -90.0 to 90.0.
Longitude.
May range from -180.0 to 180.0
The altitude in meters.
May be negative, 0, positive, or <xref href="System.Double.NaN"></xref>, if unknown.
latitude, longitude, or altitude is out of range.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> class from latitude, longitude, altitude, horizontal accuracy, vertical accuracy, speed, and course.
The latitude of the location.
May range from -90.0 to 90.0.
The longitude of the location.
May range from -180.0 to 180.0.
The altitude in meters.
May be negative, 0, positive, or <xref href="System.Double.NaN"></xref>, if unknown.
The accuracy of the latitude and longitude coordinates, in meters.
Must be greater than or equal to 0.
If a value of 0 is supplied to this constructor, the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.HorizontalAccuracy"></xref> property will be set to <xref href="System.Double.NaN"></xref>.
The accuracy of the altitude, in meters.
Must be greater than or equal to 0.
If a value of 0 is supplied to this constructor, the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.VerticalAccuracy"></xref> property will be set to <xref href="System.Double.NaN"></xref>.
The speed measured in meters per second.
May be negative, 0, positive, or <xref href="System.Double.NaN"></xref>, if unknown.
A negative speed can indicate moving in reverse.
The direction of travel, rather than orientation.
This parameter is measured in degrees relative to true north.
Must range from 0 to 360.0, or be <xref href="System.Double.NaN"></xref>.
latitude, longitude, horizontalAccuracy, verticalAccuracy, or course is out of range.
Gets the altitude of the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref>, in meters.
The altitude is given relative to sea level.
The altitude, in meters.
Gets or sets the heading in degrees, relative to true north.
The valid range includes values from 0.0 to 360.0, and `Double.NaN` if the heading is not defined.
The heading in degrees, relative to true north.
<xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Course"></xref> is set outside the valid range.
Determines if the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> object is equivalent to the parameter, based solely on latitude and longitude.

Equivalent <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate> objects have the same <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Latitude%2A> and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Longitude%2A> properties.

The <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Altitude%2A>, <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.HorizontalAccuracy%2A>, and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.VerticalAccuracy%2A> properties are not used to determine equivalency.
The <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> object to compare to the calling object.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> objects are equal; otherwise, `false`.

Determines if a specified <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> is equal to the current <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref>, based solely on latitude and longitude.

Equivalent <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate> objects have the same <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Latitude%2A> and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Longitude%2A> properties.

The <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Altitude%2A>, <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.HorizontalAccuracy%2A>, and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.VerticalAccuracy%2A> properties are not used to determine equivalency.
The object to compare the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> to.
`true`, if the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> objects are equal; otherwise, `false`.

Returns the distance between the latitude and longitude coordinates that are specified by this <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> and another specified <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref>.
The Haversine formula is used to calculate the distance.
The Haversine formula accounts for the curvature of the earth, but assumes a spherical earth rather than an ellipsoid.
For long distances, the Haversine formula introduces an error of less than 0.1 percent.
Altitude is not used to calculate the distance.
The <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> for the location to calculate the distance to.
The distance between the two coordinates, in meters.
Serves as a hash function for the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref>.
<xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate> objects that are equivalent have the same hash code.

Equivalent <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate> objects have the same <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Latitude%2A> and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Longitude%2A> properties.

The <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Altitude%2A>, <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.HorizontalAccuracy%2A>, and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.VerticalAccuracy%2A> properties are not used to determine equivalency.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref>.
Gets or sets the accuracy of the latitude and longitude that is given by the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref>, in meters.
The accuracy can be considered the radius of certainty of the latitude and longitude data.
A circular area that is formed with the accuracy as the radius and the latitude and longitude coordinates as the center contains the actual location.
The accuracy of the latitude and longitude, in meters.
<xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.HorizontalAccuracy"></xref> is set outside the valid range.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> does not contain latitude or longitude data.
A <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate> that does not contain latitude or longitude data is equal to <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Unknown>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> does not contain latitude or longitude data; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the latitude of the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref>.
Latitude can range from -90.0 to 90.0.
Latitude is measured in degrees north or south from the equator.
Positive values are north of the equator and negative values are south of the equator.
Latitude of the location.
<xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Latitude"></xref> is set outside the valid range.
Gets or sets the longitude of the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref>.
The longitude can range from -180.0 to 180.0.
Longitude is measured in degrees east or west of the prime meridian.
Negative values are west of the prime meridian, and positive values are east of the prime meridian.
The longitude.
<xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Longitude"></xref> is set outside the valid range.
Determines whether two <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> objects refer to the same location.

Equivalent <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate> objects have the same <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Latitude%2A> and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Longitude%2A> properties.

The <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Altitude%2A>, <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.HorizontalAccuracy%2A>, and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.VerticalAccuracy%2A> properties are not used to determine equivalency.
The first <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> to compare.
`true`, if the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> objects are determined to be equivalent; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether two <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> objects correspond to different locations.

Equivalent <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate> objects have the same <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Latitude%2A> and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Longitude%2A> properties.

The <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Altitude%2A>, <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.HorizontalAccuracy%2A>, and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.VerticalAccuracy%2A> properties are not used to determine equivalency.
The first <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> to compare.
`true`, if the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> objects are determined to be different; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the speed in meters per second.
The speed in meters per second.
The speed must be greater than or equal to zero, or <xref href="System.Double.NaN"></xref>.
<xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Speed"></xref> is set outside the valid range.
Returns a string that contains the latitude and longitude.
The string representation returned by this method is intended only for debugging use.
This method does not return any locale-specific formatting for latitude and longitude.
A string that contains the latitude and longitude, separated by a comma.
Represents a <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref> object that has unknown latitude and longitude fields.
The <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.IsUnknown%2A> property can be used to verify whether a <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate> contains no data.
Gets or sets the accuracy of the altitude given by the <xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate"></xref>, in meters.
The accuracy of the altitude, in meters.
<xref href="System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.VerticalAccuracy"></xref> is set outside the valid range.
